intro: Vinca soneri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces clusters of small, brightly colored blooms in shades of purple, pink, and white. It thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Vinca soneri is also valued for its ability to bloom year-round under proper care.
